text: Growing Green
Amazing Plants: Nature's Wonders
Can you name the plants you see?
Look around your garden, park, or yard.
Flowers, grass, and trees are all plants.
Some plants are very tall, like trees.
Others are small, like flowers and grass.
Most plants have roots, a stem, and leaves.
Other plants include flowers, seeds, and fruits.
They give us fresh air to breathe.
They also give us food, like fruits and vegetables.
Trees give shade on sunny days.
Flowers make our world colorful and pretty.
Each plant is important and has a story to tell.
Plants help us in many ways.

Growing Green!
From Seed to Plant: A Growing Story
Plants have many important parts.
Each part helps the plant grow.
First, there are seeds.
Seeds are like baby plants.
Seeds can be spread by wind, water, and animals.
Most seeds sleep until they are given water.
Next, plants have roots.
The roots are hidden underground but are very important.
They take in water and nutrients from the soil.
They also hold the plant to the ground.
Then, there are stems.
Stems hold up the plant.
They carry water and food between the roots and leaves.
From Seed to Plant: A Growing Story
Plants have many important parts.
Each part helps the plant grow.
First, there are seeds.
Seeds are like baby plants.
Seeds can be spread by wind, water, and animals.
Most seeds sleep until they are given water.
Next, plants have roots.
The roots are hidden underground but are very important.
They take in water and nutrients from the soil.
They also hold the plant to the ground.
Then, there are stems.
Stems hold up the plant.
They carry water and food between the roots and leaves.
Growing Green!
Flower Power: The Science of Blooms
The leaf is also an important part.
Leaves catch energy from the sunlight.
They use the sunlight to turn the air and water into food.
Some plants have colorful flowers.
Flowers make seeds.
And they hold the seeds until they blow away and new plants grow.
Flowers turn into fruits and vegetables.
The fruit protects the growing seeds.
Plants give us food to eat and the air to breathe.
So plants are important to humans.
Next time you see a plant, remember to thank it for all it does!
